decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with low-cost creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Humbling Elder, while also disrupting opponent's plays with counterspells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through cards like Of One Mind and Ninja of the Deep Hours, and to control the tempo of the game using cards like Snap. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while being able to counter their threats effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Faerie Seer, while using counterspells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell to control the opponent's plays. Moon-Circuit Hacker and Ninja of the Deep Hours provide card advantage, allowing for sustained aggression. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Dispel and Bind the Monster to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and counterspells in order to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to build a fast and aggressive board presence with low-cost creatures and cards that generate mana quickly. By utilizing ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth, the deck aims to quickly accelerate into powerful threats like Avenging Hunter and Annoyed Altisaur. Writhing Chrysalis and Eldrazi Repurposer provide additional versatility and disruption to the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck is designed to overwhelm opponents early in the game with a combination of speed and powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards that provide additional value such as Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize. By combining cheap creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Kitchen Imp with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total quickly and efficiently. The mana base of Bloodfell Caves and Jagged Barrens supports the Rakdos color combination, allowing for consistent casting of spells.

The goal of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures with abilities that trigger when spells are cast, along with a suite of burn spells. By using efficient creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker, as well as direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent and finish them off with a burst of burn damage. Additionally, cards like Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery provide extra value and card advantage to help maintain momentum.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and bounce spells. The deck aims to control the board early on with card draw and efficient removal spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with tempo advantage and superior board presence. The inclusion of cards like Tolarian Terror and Sleep of the Dead help to further solidify the aggressive strategy, while maintaining a relatively low mana curve to ensure consistency and speed.

The main concept of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to continuously apply pressure on the opponent with low-cost creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher, while also fueling your own hand with cards like Grim Bauble and Fanatical Offering. Utilizing efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Eviscerator's Insight helps clear the way for your aggressive creatures to push through damage. The deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain aggression throughout the game, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and burning spells to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. It leverages the synergies between cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary to flood the board with creatures, while also utilizing efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse help maintain card advantage and ensure a steady flow of threats, while cards like Fireblast provide extra reach to close out games.

The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent through burn spells and aggressive creature attacks, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Fireblast, and Fiery Temper. By combining efficient removal and card draw spells like Faithless Looting and Lava Dart, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and maintain an aggressive board presence with creatures like Guttersnipe and Voldaren Epicure. The deck aims to end the game quickly and efficiently through a combination of direct damage and creature aggression.

The deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and powerful card draw to control the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells like Cast Down and Snuff Out while cycling through the deck with cards like Thought Scour and Ponder. Gurmag Angler and Tolarian Terror provide powerful threats to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Mental Note and Contaminated Aquifer to gain card advantage and stay ahead in the resource game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, sacrifice effects, and card advantage through Ichor Wellspring. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Snuff Out and Defile, while also generating value through cards like Reckoner's Bargain and Pulse of Murasa. The inclusion of cards like Crypt Rats and Troll of Khazad-dûm provide board control options, while also utilizing Khalni Garden to create chump blockers. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through resource denial and incremental advantage.

The main strategy of this Golgari/Jund Garden control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using removal spells such as Cast Down and Crypt Incursion. The deck also aims to generate value through cards like Ichor Wellspring and Refurbished Familiar. Crypt Rats and Pactdoll Terror provide additional board control options, while Troll of Khazad-dûm and Eviscerator's Insight serve as win conditions. The mana base includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Witch's Cottage to further enhance the deck's control elements. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and slowly grinding out a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence of small creatures that can sacrifice each other to grow stronger and overwhelm the opponent. It uses cards like Mortician Beetle and Bloodthrone Vampire to benefit from sacrificing creatures, while also incorporating removal spells like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption to maintain momentum. The goal is to keep pressure on the opponent by constantly sacrificing and reanimating creatures, ultimately leading to a quick victory through aggressive plays.

The main focus of this aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells. By utilizing a combination of creature damage and direct damage spells, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through card draw effects. The inclusion of lifelink and drain effects helps to offset any life loss from aggressive plays, while also providing additional reach in finishing off the opponent. The deck's streamlined approach allows for consistent pressure and fast wins.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and evasive creatures to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. By consistently maintaining a low mana curve, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, the deck has a card draw engine with Ninja of the Deep Hours to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tolarian Terror, and Cryptic Serpent, while also controlling the board with counterspells like Counterspell, Spell Pierce, and Dispel. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thought Scour to maintain momentum. Sleep of the Dead can help lock down opponents' creatures, while Deem Inferior and Lórien Revealed provide additional ways to control the game. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game.
